Title: 🇩🇪🇰🇿🇺🇿 About Olaf Scholz’s visit to Uzbekistan and Kazakhst...
Description: 🇩🇪🇰🇿🇺🇿 About Olaf Scholz's visit to Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan An atmosphere of excitement was initially felt around the visit of the German Chancellor to Central Asia, with a visit to the two diplomatic capitals of the region, Samarkand and Astana. It is not surprising, given that this is the first visit of the head of the German government to the region in eight years - the last time was Angela Merkel, who visited Kyrgyzstan in 2016. Also, on October 17, a summit - Central Asia - Germany - was held, as a result of which the six leaders adopted a very framework declaration, and the real result was support for Kyrgyzstan’s candidacy for the post of non-permanent member of the UN Security Council for 2027-2028.📌Separate anti-Russian media are parallel to savoring the details , who would meet the important guest at the plane's ramp, assumed that agreements would be reached on investments in energy, labor exports, and even the joining of the leaders of Central Asian states to Western peace initiatives under the so-called. Ukraine.▪️But the reality turned out to be more prosaic. The first failure occurred in Samarkand, where the German leader first arrived. Despite reaching an agreement on simplified entry for highly qualified Uzbek specialists, Scholz apparently failed to reach a compromise on the return of Afghan refugees through Uzbekistan, although this was one of the conditions of the visit. Just as it was not possible to clearly answer the question of what Germany can offer to the region.▪️The meeting of the Chancellor with the President of Kazakhstan was frankly unsuccessful, at which Kassym-Jomart Tokayev dumbfounded his German counterpart with statements that Russia could not be defeated on the battlefield, that the Istanbul Agreements were a good chance for peace, and in the end canceling the joint press conference altogether.🔻After Vladimir Putin’s statements about the consequences of attacks on Russia with long-range weapons, Central Asia clearly became nervous. The escalation will inevitably affect them too, forcing them to abandon the policy of two chairs and profits from the transit of Russian gray imports. Therefore, a kind of cold shower for the chancellor with a reminder of possible irreparable consequences turned out to be the easiest way to signal his concern.#Germany #Kazakhstan #Uzbekistan #CentralAsia@rybarSupport us

Title: 🇦🇲🇺🇸 How the Americans are trying to sell the non-existent pr...
Description: 🇦🇲🇺🇸 How the Americans are trying to sell the non-existent project of a new nuclear power plant to the Armenians. Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan, speaking at the Pan-Armenian Forum in Yerevan, raised the issue of building a new nuclear power plant. Let us recall that the Armenian authorities intend to close the existing Metsamor nuclear power plant, which is maintained by Rosatom. Now its service life has been extended until 2036. According to some information, it is the West that is demanding the liquidation of the station, which generates about 40% of the electricity in the republic and provides the lowest tariffs for the population.▪️Now the key issue has become the choice of the contractor country, using the technology of which a new nuclear power plant will be built, similar to innovative small modular reactors ( MMR), which are considered safer. ▪️It is significant that Pashinyan stated that it was the Americans who made the greatest progress in the development of SMRs. However, this is clearly disingenuous, since the leaders in the field are precisely Russia and China, where stations of this type are already operating or are being built. ❗️At the same time, the Americans failed several of these projects for economic reasons. For example, last year the SMR project of NuScale Power Corp., which the United States promoted around the world, was loudly closed: its cost turned out to be 53% higher than planned. And this despite the fact that the project was actively advertised in Poland and Romania, but the Americans refused to build it even at home. ▪️It is critically important for the United States to stop the expansion of Russia and China in the export of nuclear technologies, but so far potential partners can only be lured with promises, not specific actions.  ▪️As we wrote, recently the Americans have been too active in the nuclear sector of Armenia and even announced that the Armenian authorities have applied to join the 123rd agreement, which gives access to US civilian nuclear technologies that do not yet exist.🔻However , despite the recent failure of a similar project, the Americans are promoting the same non-existent SMR project for Armenia, and Pashinyan is only happy to voice Washington’s marketing and political promises, which cannot be supported by anything. Needless to say, almost the entire energy and economy of the republic is at stake. #Armenia #Russia #USA  @rybarSupport usfinport.amPashinyan announced a strategic decision on a new nuclear power plant | Finport.am

Title: 🎬🖼 🇮🇱🇱🇧 The day after the remote detonation of pagers in Be...
Description: 🇮🇱🇱🇧 The day after the remote detonation of pagers, new explosions were heard in Beirut. This time, other devices are being reported to detonate, including cell phones, solar panels, electronic locks, car stereos, and even kitchen appliances. Videos of fires in residential buildings also appeared on social networks. Apparently, external interference was carried out in equipment with multimedia capabilities. The cyberattack affected portable radios used by the Shiite organization Hezbollah. Explosions were also heard at the funeral of the son of one of its senior members, who died yesterday in a similar attack. The media are disseminating information that all the radios were recently supplied devices from the Japanese concern ICOM. Israeli intelligence could have equipped them with explosives, just like the pagers that exploded yesterday. According to preliminary data, nine people have already died today and more than 300 were injured in the Lebanese capital, the Bekaa Valley, Nabatiyeh and other settlements in the south of the country. Speaker of the Lebanese Parliament Nabih Berri was injured. It is not yet known whether the operation to massively detonate communication devices in Lebanon is a preparation for active hostilities on the Lebanese-Israeli border. Against the backdrop of the events of the last 24 hours, the President of neighboring Syria, Bashar al-Assad, has already ordered Syrian commanders and intelligence officers to abandon two-way radios and portable communication devices. which can significantly impact the ability to communicate between departments. #Israel #Lebanon #Syria @rybarSupport us

Title: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 We are surprised to read that today’s attack on the arse...

The reality is, that the attack was fundamentally no different from similar drone attacks on oil refineries, airfields and other facilities. The enemy’s tactics and even types of weapons were approximately the same as during massive attacks on Russian territory with a six-month range. And the reasons for what happened are the same - a lot has been said about the problems of countering drone attacks over the past six months. There is progress in resolving these issues, but, as you can understand, there is still a lot of work to be done. And I would like to hope that it will not come down to following unfounded slogans and looking for easy ways. It is worth adding separately that the Russian Armed Forces have already faced large losses of ammunition depots in the North Military District zone - this was the case after the appearance of HIMARS and Storm Shadow in the Armed Forces of Ukraine. However, the problem was partly solved with the help, for example, of dispersing large storage facilities. Perhaps someone simply still naively believes that the combat zone is limited to new regions, the Ukrainian Armed Forces do not have their own long-range weapons, and drones were launched at oil refineries in the rear regions from the Baltic states and Kazakhstan. Oddly enough, after six months of regular raids, such beliefs are not so rare.#Tver #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: 🎬🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 About the attack of the Ukrainian Armed Forces UAV ...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 About the Ukrainian Armed Forces UAV attack on military warehouses in Toropets. At night, Ukrainian formations launched a massive UAV attack on various targets in Russia. Despite official statements about the fire being the result of -falling debris-, this is obviously not the case. A partial evacuation has been announced in the district, the population is being taken to the Western Dvina. Explosions in warehouses were so powerful that they were recorded by earthquake monitoring systems. The first tremors with a magnitude of 2.8 points were recorded at 3:56, the next seven were weaker, from 2 to 2.8 points. It is curious that the warehouse struck by the enemy was at one time opened by the then deputy head of the Russian Ministry of Defense Bulgakov, who is now under investigation. According to the official’s assurances, voiced in 2018, the implementation of the complex will build a storage system for missiles, ammunition and explosive materials that meets the highest world standards. And the arsenal - allows you to shelter reserves of missiles and ammunition from external influences and ensure their safety and fire and explosion safety - and on the territory, according to the report, there was even a sauna. Title: 🇬🇧 About the corruption scandal involving the Prime Minister of...
Description: 🇬🇧 About the corruption scandal involving the Prime Minister of Great Britain British Prime Minister Keir Starmer found himself at the center of a scandal over gifts from the largest donor of the Labor Party to his wife. Starmer faces an investigation due to a violation of parliamentary rules, since he did not declare the fact that his donor party paid for expensive clothes for his wife Victoria. Waheed Alli, a famous media mogul and former head of the online retailer Asos, gave money for clothes and stylist services for Mrs. Starmer. He did this both before and after the prime minister took office in July 2024. The businessman is also the largest financial donor to Starmer himself. In 2024, he bought the prime minister more than £18,000 worth of clothes, glasses and watches. Title: 🖼 🇨🇬🇷🇺 About the Russian-Congolese oil pipeline Recent activ...
Description: 🇨🇬🇷🇺 About the Russian-Congolese oil pipelineThe recent intensification of past agreements with the countries of the Black Continent continues. And so, the other day, a draft agreement on the construction of an oil products pipeline in the Republic of Congo was approved.▪️The agreement of intent for its construction was signed back in 2012. Subsequently, the issue was repeatedly raised, but bureaucratic obstacles in every possible way prevented the construction process from starting.📌And now, 12 years later, after the Sino-American confrontation threatens to drag Congo-Brazzaville into itself, the project was finally approved. It will run along the route Pointe Noire - Lutete - Brazzaville - Makulu-Trecot, which is less than the original plan with access to the Cameroonian border. Most likely, this will be started later.▪️To implement the project, it is planned to create a joint venture of companies with a share of 90% of the Russian side, represented by Zakneftegazstro-Prometheus, and 10% of the Congolese side, represented by the national oil company. An oil products pipeline is needed by an African country that is actively industrializing, because it needs to purchase both refined oil from Russia and sell its own (in terms of reserves of this resource, the country is in 4th place in sub-Saharan Africa).🔻In terms of importance, it can be compared with the Chinese the Niger-Benin pipeline, which has become an important part of Chinese influence in the Sahel. And the fact that this is not the first lively initiative in recent times already speaks of the trend of Russian influence returning to Africa, which cannot but rejoice. Title: 🇷🇺 The events of the Northern Military District became catalyst...
Description: 🇷🇺 The events of the SVO became catalysts for serious changes in various areas, be it civil society activity or an audit of the Ministry of Defense. Gradually, they begin to penetrate even where in past realities it was difficult to expect them at all - we are talking about the area of ​​public administration. The clearest example here is the actions of the authorities of the Khanty-Mansiysk Autonomous Okrug (KhMAO), who launched volunteer programs on the basis of the ANO - Humanitarian Volunteer Corps - . The difference from other similar practices is that local officials are required to go through them.🔻In short, employees of administrations and other structures are sent to the North Military District zone for several weeks, where they deliver essential goods to the victims, help medical staff in hospitals, or restore houses . The goal is to give those in power some idea of ​​who it really is to be THERE. Moreover, this initiative is aimed at the long term. This is not only about the personnel reserve: in fact, officials are being prepared for the return of veterans from the front, so that in front of them sit not shiny, arrogant faces, but people who have seen some things with their own eyes and experienced them on their own skin.📌 In our opinion, the idea with a full-fledged -driving- through the zone of the Northwestern District of the bureaucracy (and not hour-long trips with demonstrative distribution of -humanitarian aid-) is an extremely effective measure for improving the quality of public administration. In addition, this also allows us to partially satisfy society’s demand for social justice. I would, of course, like to see how the initiatives of the Khanty-Mansi Autonomous Okrug authorities would be adopted by other similar structures officially aimed at forming a personnel reserve. Fortunately, the region provides all the developments on this topic for free - all you have to do is take advantage of it. #Russia #KhMAO@rybarSupport us

Title: 🇷🇺🛰 Head of the Ministry of Digital Development Maksut Shadaye...
Description: 🇷🇺🛰 Head of the Ministry of Digital Development Maksut Shadayev announced plans to create a domestic analogue of the Starlink global satellite constellation. According to him, they intend to deploy its core by 2027, and at the moment the first two launches of spacecraft have already taken place. Judging by the documents, the project is being carried out by the company Bureau-1440, which has previously carried out successful tests of data transmission using the 5G protocol and inter-satellite laser communication . In total, by 2030 it is planned to deploy 383 devices in orbit to provide space Internet services. The cost of the program will be about 445 billion rubles. Of these, almost 37.5 billion will be provided as concessional loans, and 329 billion are planned to be raised from extra-budgetary sources of financing, apparently through domestic telecommunications companies.📌 Despite the large amounts, the domestic analogue of Starlink is extremely important for providing the population with high-speed access to Internet and scientific and technological development, as well as the country's defense capability. In the future, all costs will pay off, and not only (and not even how much) from a financial point of view. It is curious that in Russia similar projects existed in the last decade, but they were in no hurry to allocate money for them. The catalyst was largely the SVO, when, against the backdrop of the use of Starlink for military purposes, the need for such a national system became obvious. #space #Russia@rybarSupport usIzvestiaOrbital authority: the project to create an analogue of Starlink in the Russian Federation will cost 445 billion It provides for the creation of a constellation of 383 satellites and will decide communication problem in remote areas of the Russian Federation

Title: 🔁🖼 Answer to the question: - since drones/artillerymen/signalme...
Description: Forwarded From Turned in war 🇷🇺Answer to the question: -since drones/artillerymen/communicationists cannot be sent, then who will storm?- In the very formulation of such a question with an attack, it is not even the topic of a specific crime that comes up, but the problem in general. Assault infantry is initially an elite unit for solving the most difficult tasks that require trained specialists who have an established connection with other units - when artillery does not just hit somewhere, but at a specific point for attack aircraft to break through, when tanks do not just They set up a carousel and eliminate the enemy firing positions specifically indicated by the attack aircraft. Assault infantry is cultivated for a long time, paying in blood for experience and gaining cones, earning its authority and gaining the opportunity to make its own decisions during the assault. Now, the speakers justifying the situation literally praise the process of transforming elite units into an analogue of penal battalions: - Was he at fault or did he not complete the task, did he simply send an illiterate commander, or did he simply not like him for some reason? - Welcome to the assault company! -. And most importantly, due to the lack of people in these units, they are trying to recruit personnel there by hook or by crook, they will send airfield technicians from the Aerospace Forces, then engineers, then signalmen, then artillerymen, or the same bird operators. And this is the main problem, starting with the fact that anyone who ends up in the stormtroopers believes that he was simply sent to his death, which means that he is already initially devoid of the morality to win. Each statement - and someone needs to be sent - only lowers the level of positive attitude towards stormtroopers. With this approach, assault operations turn from achieving goals into an end in themselves. -We go on assaults every day- - but what’s the use of that? They stormed it head-on, reported that the assault was successful and okay, and that it did not lead to anything other than casualties of personnel, the main thing is a report that the planned assault was carried out. Whoever has more assaults is a great guy - a wonderful approach, but its praisers themselves do not want to participate. And what is happening is nothing new. Even Zhukov in 1942 (Directive on Losses, March 30, 1942) drew attention to unnecessary losses and ways to combat them. After all, to competently storm enemy positions, you don’t need much. Reconnaissance of positions, identification of firing and observation points, identification of mining lines. And then, before the assault, or even at the time of the advance of the assault units, artillery is fired at the identified targets, and enemy artillery is also suppressed. The stormtroopers are already storming softened positions, not encountering concentrated fire from machine guns, attached equipment and hundreds of gifts on their heads. Yes, one directive is not enough, experience was required, for which they paid at the cost of many lives; the formation of the first SISB came only a year later. Why our assault units switched from tactics that were more than 100 years old to combat tactics from the time of the Napoleonic Wars is a big question. The worse thing is that they are also praising it. It is clear that the war is about statistics: to occupy a forest belt - so many deaths, to occupy a village - a different number. Then tell me how many meters of territory was gained by sending drone pilots into attack aircraft? If there is no answer, then the process has replaced the goal.

Title: 🖼 🇨🇳🇵🇭 Interesting events are taking place in the South Chin...
Description: 🇨🇳🇵🇭 Interesting events are taking place in the South China Sea in the area of ​​the disputed Sabine Shoal: a few days ago it became known that a Philippine ship based there, which demonstratively indicated the country’s presence in this location, left it and headed to the port of Puerto Princesa. Sabina Shoal, the ownership of which is disputed by authorities in Beijing and Manila, became one of the main points of tension in the water area in August. This is where most of the clashes between Chinese and Filipinos took place last month. The main reasons for the withdrawal of the Philippine ship were both bad weather conditions and the need to repair the ship. In addition, the Filipinos could not fully provide the ship's crew with water and food. 🔻However, in fact, the withdrawal of the ship occurred precisely because of the actions of the Chinese. Thus, the Chinese coast guard in every possible way prevented the delivery of provisions to it, and also rammed a Philippine ship, causing significant damage to it. Now Beijing can take advantage of this opportunity to consolidate its presence on the disputed shoal. Although Manila says that they can send other ships to replace it at any time, there are always Chinese ships around Sabin, whose crews do not intend to let outsiders through. Therefore, we will not be surprised if the Chinese coast guard sends even more equipment there in order to prevent any attempts by the Filipinos to gain a foothold on the shallows. Given China's reaction to any actions by the Philippines in the South China Sea, a new round of tension in the region is not far off. However, joint patrols of the water area will clearly be used as an additional tool to deter the PRC. At the same time, from an information point of view, QUAD representatives do not even need to invent anything. Indeed, in the same publications of Western media, it is the Chinese who almost always appear as poachers engaged in illegal fishing in the region. Thus, the authors of the initiative are killing two birds with one stone - under the pretext of fighting illegal fishing, the authorities of the United States, Japan, Australia and India will demonstrate the capabilities of coordinated actions to contain China. #Australia #India #USA #Japan@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport usKyodo News+Quad plans joint patrols in Indo-Pacific to counter illegal fishingJapan, the United States, Australia and India plan to launch joint patrols to monitor vessels in the Indo-Pacific , diplomatic sources say, in the latest effort by the Quad group to counter illegal fishing in waters where China's influence is growing.

Description: ❗️🇰🇬🇷🇺🖇 -Rybar - announces enrollment of listeners for the second season of the full-time Media School in Kyrgyzstan. Just a couple of months ago we held the release of the first wave, and the second, even more intense and longer, is approaching. The training will begin in September, will be held full-time and will last two months. 🔻What is included in the course program? Basic knowledge (theory and a lot of practice) in storytelling, Telegram journalism, producing, creating and promoting media content on the Internet. The general flow will be divided into three areas: writing texts, working with videos and producing podcasts. 🔻Who is this for? For those who want to launch their own media project on Telegram or any other social network, but do not yet understand how to do it. For beginners and experienced media workers. There are no age, gender or property restrictions. 🔻What can listeners expect? Blocks of lectures and practical classes three times a week, as well as six-hour intensive courses on weekends. Master classes, reviews and webinars, constant online chat support with the management of the Media School. All students will receive diplomas, and the best students will receive valuable gifts and the opportunity to join the Rybar team or launch their own project with our support. And all this is completely free. 🔻What do we expect from listeners? Curiosity, desire to develop, change the world for the better, make society open and transparent. And we want civic journalism to develop. And, of course, we are looking for talented future colleagues. ➖Really free? And you won’t have to write something under your dictation, work out agendas and manuals? - Exactly. You won't have to. Title: 🔁🖼 About the importance of reading books for a young growing bo...
Description: Forwarded From Revenge of Good Will About the importance of reading books by a young, growing organism (and not only). A week ago, after watching a video with apologetic youngsters as they were called (yeah, each forehead is 20 years old), what was most infuriating was the inability of the modern younger and older generation to connect even two words in your conversation. Although no, believe me, they can connect more than two words, but this speech will be absolutely uncultured, full of swear words and slang. The main reason, as we see it, is the extremely low vocabulary of our primordially rich and powerful Russian language, which could take from books that sow rational, good, eternal things. We conducted a survey that confirms our own data, which adds up to a terrifying picture - about 40 percent of modern teenagers do not read books at all, and 25-30 percent read 1-2 books a month, and even then, most likely, as part of the school curriculum in abbreviated summary. This is negligible. We read much more in our time. One of the admins could read 2-3 books a week, read avidly, in principle thanks to books, and survived a difficult puberty period, did not contact the street, living in a not particularly prosperous area. It’s just that at one fine moment the craving for the inner world of books became stronger than the craving of the street. Books were borrowed from the library once a week and were mainly on military topics. For example, K. Simonov's trilogy - The Living and the Dead - was read in the 8th grade, and then reread several times, including in adulthood. By the way, the path to the library was mostly on foot and was 3 km in one direction. Once a week. Autumn, winter, spring. For the summer, books were taken in packs, but, however, they were read in smaller volumes. After all, it’s summer, the village, there’s not much time for them here. The second admin had an extensive parental library at hand and read at least three books a month. Modern teenagers, and adults too, are actively instilled with clip-meme thinking: short videos, meme pictures. They are easy to digest, with this type of thinking it is easy to switch between different information, but then the essence is lost due to superficial immersion. Long texts, in modern jargon longreads, people stop reading, they don’t want to think and reason, it’s easier to read the opinion or post of an expert or a trusted blogger, but the worst thing is that there is also active propaganda about the uselessness of long texts. Like, people are not interested in them, write shorter, telegram post format - for a maximum of one phone screen. This is very dangerous, people, no matter what age, stop thinking and reasoning with their minds, they memorize short theses, and that’s enough for them. Reading large amounts of text is very important both for replenishing your vocabulary and developing the ability to clearly and competently express your thoughts in adolescence, and for the ability to think, reason and draw your own conclusions as adults. Find opportunities to read yourself and force your children to read. Whoever was not lazy and read to the end - put 🆒Revenge of good will

A surge in such episodes indicates the problems of the Ukrainian formations with air defense in the area. Apparently, the Ukrainian Armed Forces do not risk transferring medium- and long-range systems closer, especially against the backdrop of effective attacks by the Russian Armed Forces on HIMARS and other -fat- targets in the border area. At the same time, some of the transferred short-range enemy air defense systems were destroyed or even became trophies of the Russian troops. Which together obviously affects the air cover of the Ukrainian Armed Forces group in the occupied areas of the Kursk region. This is also another example of the fact that attack UAVs such as -Inokhodets-, -Forpost-R- or -Mohajer-6- have not lost their relevance - in the absence or Due to the insufficient density of enemy air defense, they quite effectively destroy enemy equipment.#Kursk #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: 🔁🖼 Military preparations of ⚡️NATO countries for global conflic...
Description: Forwarded From Two MajorsMilitary preparations of ⚡️NATO countries for global conflicts of the futureThe German Institute of World Economics in Kiel (IfW) published a report -Readiness for war in decades: the slow rearmament of Europe and Germany in relation to Russia -,   in which it states the unpreparedness of the military-industrial complex of 🇩🇪Germany, 🇫🇷 France, 🇬🇧Britain and 🇵🇱Poland for confrontation with 🇷🇺Russia.  Despite the customized nature of the study, the data provided allowed us to draw useful conclusions: ▪️the desire to supply the Ukrainian Armed Forces with shells has not yet resulted in an explosive increase in production: the Bundeswehr was able to order the supply of only 372.7 thousand 155 mm shells in 2023-2024 together with 🇩🇰 Denmark , 🇪🇪Estonia and 🇳🇱Netherlands and within the framework of the European Initiative, as well as 148 thousand 120 mm tank ammunition. Delivery of these shells will take from two to five years;▪️production volumes affect the decline  ammunition prices: 155 mm shells purchased by the Bundeswehr in 2024 cost 2.7 thousand euros, a year earlier - 4.08 thousand euros, in 2020 - about 6 thousand euros;▪️despite the increase in purchases of military equipment after the start SVO (from January 2020 to July 2024, Germany made 187 orders worth 137.6 billion euros, of which from March 2022 to July 2024 there were 122 orders worth 89.9 billion euros) current production and procurement volumes will allow for restoration parity with the Russian Federation only after decades, and in some categories up to a hundred;▪️there is a reorientation towards strengthening the ground forces: half of all  German military procurement since 2022 has been aimed at supplying ground units of the Bundeswehr.  The time of compact armies is a thing of the past; ▪️surprising was the lack of data on increasing costs for the purchase of unmanned systems.  Instead, Germany ordered 35 fifth-generation F-35 aircraft in 2022.▪️ Until 2024, a significant part of German military purchases went only to replace the weapons supplied to Ukraine, but now the focus is on restoring its own capabilities.✨Such publications in the West are used to prepare public opinions on the rapid waste of governments on military purchases. Well, when the contracts are completed and NATO warehouses are full, it will be difficult to stop the military machine, which brings super-profits to the owners of transnational military-industrial complexes. Two majors

Title: 🖼 🇾🇪🇺🇸 On the effectiveness of the Yemeni Houthis’ air defen...
Description: 🇾🇪🇺🇸 On the effectiveness of the air defense system of the Yemeni Houthis Since the beginning of the aggravation of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict on October 7, 2023, fighters of the Ansarallah movement not only quite successfully prevented commercial shipping in the Red Sea region, but also with enviable consistency destroyed drones of the Western coalition, in particular American ones MQ-9A Reaper. Thus, in the Yemeni province of Damar, the Houthi air defense neutralized the tenth Reaper since the beginning of the escalation in Palestine and Israel. Taking into account the cost of one individual strike and reconnaissance drone at $30 million, in total the Yemeni fighters in slippers have accumulated such UAVs in the amount of $310 million.🔻Given the number of American drones intercepted by the Houthis, who do not have high technological capabilities, it is quite the reputation of the most consistent defenders of the Palestinian people has been successfully established. In this matter, the Yemenis can be envied: it is enough to compare how comfortable American reconnaissance UAVs feel over the same Black Sea and how the issue of foreign presence in the airspace of the poor republic is resolved by the Ansaralli fighters.📌It is also worth It should be noted that in addition to the downed UAVs, the Yemenis have plenty of reasons to rejoice: just yesterday they struck the central part of Israel. The launched rocket flew approximately 2000 km and fell in an open area. The Israelis failed to intercept it. Most likely, as part of a symbolic response, the United States will bomb the territory of Yemen, but it is more likely to again be ineffective: during the years of the war, Ansarallah managed to build a network of underground bases, at the same time establishing false launch positions on the surface. Title: 🖼 🇪🇹 Situation in Ethiopia: Fano's push towards the Sudanese b...
Description: 🇪🇹 The situation in Ethiopia: the Fano push to the Sudanese border While the Ethiopian authorities attracted attention only in the context of the crisis in Somalia or Sudan, the war continued inside the country. The Fano rebels, who rebelled against the oppression of the Amhara people, achieved great success over the last month.▪️So, during the fighting from August to September, they reached the border with Sudan through the city of Matema. Ethiopian troops, finding themselves pressed against the territory of another state, surrendered to the Amharians. After this, the rebels continued their movement, occupying the abandoned headquarters of the armed forces in Shinfa.▪️In the center of Amhara, the Amharas also made progress. Between Gondar and Bahir Dar they occupied six waders (zones), in which local representatives were elected by popular vote. -Fano - thus receives support from the people, showing that they are not thugs, as they are portrayed in the local media. There is also a response among the population who join the ranks of the rebels. So, from mid-summer, designations of Amharic army corps began to appear in reports, which means an increase in the number in the ranks of Fano.▪️At this time, the Ethiopian authorities are busy escalating relations with Somalia. After an international scandal related to the initiative to lease the port of Berbera in unrecognized Somaliland, the parties did not stop and are in the final stage before signing a memorandum.🔻As we wrote earlier, all this pressure on the Somali authorities and negotiations with Somaliland is just a way to find an external enemy for unity peoples of Ethiopia. Only, as the rebels -Fano- show, the plan doesn’t work out very well. High resolution mapEnglish version#Africa #Ethiopia@rybarSupport us

Title: 🇪🇬🇺🇸 On American investment in the Egyptian army on September...
Description: 🇪🇬🇺🇸 About American investment in the Egyptian army On September 11, the US government approved military assistance to Egypt in the amount of $1.3 billion. Despite the fact that the Americans accuse the al-Sisi regime of human rights violations, they have to admit that the Egyptian authorities are the guarantor of security in Africa and the Middle East. The merits of the leadership in Cairo as a mediator in negotiations between Israel and Hamas were mainly noted. At the same time, the Egyptian side does not need to strengthen the army in this direction. But Egyptian support for Somalia, which is being pressured by the Ethiopian authorities, is a more likely goal. The Americans have long wanted to curtail the African Union mission in the country, since they are the main sponsors, but they don’t see the point in it. And then, recently, the Egyptian authorities appeared, offering 10 thousand military personnel and supplies of weapons. Of course, the main funds will go to modernize the Egyptian armed forces, but some of them will still go to equip the military infrastructure in Somalia.🔻Probably, the American leadership is like this will try to appease Egypt and maintain its position in Somalia with a new mediator, but time will tell what will come of it.#Africa #Egypt #Somalia #USA #Ethiopia@rybarSupport usReutersUS grants Egypt $1.3 billion in military aid, overriding rights conditionsThe Biden administration is overriding human rights conditions on military aid to Egypt, a State Department spokesperson said on Wednesday, granting the U.S. ally its full allocation of $1.3 billion this year for the first time during this administration…

Title: 🇹🇲🇮🇷🇹🇷 About Turkmenistan’s next attempts to break into new...
Description: 🇹🇲🇮🇷🇹🇷 On Turkmenistan’s next attempts to break into new gas markets, Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov recently held talks with Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian in Tehran. Among the documents signed: memorandums of understanding between Turkmengaz and the National Gas Company of Iran, as well as between the ports of Turkmenbashi and Amirabad. Iranian media call the documents -strategic-. Why became clear after Berdymukhamedov returned from Tehran. Chairman Khalk Maslahaty said that gas supplies to Iran will be increased to 40 billion cubic meters per year. Moreover, just this July, both countries agreed on supplies of up to 10 billion cubic meters of gas per year, and the entire gas production in Turkmenistan over the past year amounted to 76 billion cubic meters. In the near future, under the swap scheme, it is planned to export Turkmen natural gas to Iraq and further to Turkey. 🔻It is important for Ankara to resolve the issue of importing Turkmen gas, and there is mutual interest here. Currently, the buyers of Turkmen gas are China, Iran and Russia. However, the growth rate of China's economy is declining, and therefore Ashgabat hopes to redirect gas to European markets: attempts to approach these projects previously failed before they began. Ankara's plans include turning Turkey into a regional gas hub. In July, Turkish Energy Minister Alparslan Bayraktar already said that the agreement on swap supplies with Ashgabat was nearing completion. If Berdimuhamedov really agreed with Tehran, then Ankara's plans are close to implementation. #Turkmenistan #Iran #Turkey #Central Asia #economy@rybarSupport usIRNA RussianPresident: strategic agreements have been reached between Iran and TurkmenistanTehran, August 28, IRNA - The President said that between Iran and Turkmenistan Turkmenistan reached strategic agreements.

Description: ❗️🇷🇺🇺🇦🎞 Chronicle of a special military operation: events of the week 09 - 15 September 2024▪️Over the past week, Russian troops launched a series of attacks on enemy targets in the so-called territory. Ukraine. In the Dnepropetrovsk region, a plant in Pavlograd, where the production of UAVs was organized, was hit. ▪️And in the Cherkasy region, drones of the Russian Armed Forces hit the command and control center, barracks and warehouses on the territory of the Uman airfield. Two Ukrainian SU-27s and foreign-made radar stations were also damaged. ▪️In the part of the DPR occupied by the Ukrainian Armed Forces, Russian troops worked at the enemy’s temporary deployment point in Kramatorsk. Also, a blow was struck at the repair base of heavy equipment of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on the territory of a former driving school. ▪️In turn, Ukrainian formations again launched more than 140 drones in the rear regions of Russia. In the Moscow region, drones attacked two apartment buildings in Ramenskoye, resulting in the death of a civilian. ▪️Another target of enemy attacks was the Olenya airbase in the Murmansk region, where air defense was activated several times. None of the drones were able to reach the facility; all the devices were successfully intercepted.▪️As ​​for the Kursk region, a counteroffensive by Russian troops began in the Korenevsky district. Within a week, at least ten settlements were liberated, including Snagost.▪️In the Glushkovsky district, Ukrainian formations were able to establish control over the village of Novy Put. The presence of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the area of ​​the Tetkino railway station was also confirmed.▪️In the Sudzhansky district, Russian attack aircraft knocked out Ukrainian formations from several settlements. In Cherkassy Porechny, the Armed Forces of Ukraine held the defense on the northern outskirts, while units of the Russian Armed Forces occupied positions in forest belts on the approaches to the village.#video #digest #map #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us Video is too big

Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Artyomovsk direction: successes of Russian troops in ...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Artemovsk direction: successes of Russian troops in the area of ​​Kalinovo and Kleshcheevkisituation towards the end of September 15, 2024 In the Artemovsk direction, Russian troops are biting into enemy defenses in several sectors of the front at once. Units of the Russian Armed Forces managed to expand the zone of control both in the Grigorovka area in the north and to the west of Kleshcheevka.▪️Russian troops knocked out the Ukrainian Armed Forces from several positions north of Zheleznodorozhny (Zaliznyansky), reviving the frozen section of the front. Taking into account the geographical features of the area and information from our sources, we can say that at the moment the advance of Russian troops is significantly greater than what can be confirmed by the available personnel. ▪️Southwest of Grigorovka, Russian attack aircraft have made significant progress, taking control of a forested area and physically cutting off one of the roads leading to the village. The Russian Ministry of Defense also announced the liberation of the settlement, which, apparently, will be confirmed by the relevant personnel in the near future.▪️To the south, units of Russian troops crossed the Seversky Donets-Donbass canal and liberated a significant part of Kalinovo, gaining a foothold in apartment buildings. The village became the site of fierce battles because of its importance for the Armed Forces of Ukraine - the occupation of positions by the Russian Armed Forces in this area will allow them to launch an offensive to the south, bypassing the enemy’s defensive lines in the Oktyabrsky microdistrict in Chasovoy Yar. ❗️Russian attack aircraft are methodically clearing the positions of Ukrainian formations, using all available means to do this. During one of these operations, a fighter of the Russian Armed Forces destroyed personnel at a stronghold of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, equipped in a pipe under a railway bridge, by throwing a backpack with an anti-tank mine inside. Despite the certain danger of using anti-tank mines in this way, the tactic is becoming increasingly widespread among Russian assault groups. ▪️To the northwest of Kleshcheevka, the command of the Russian Armed Forces is conducting an offensive with the goal of knocking out the Ukrainian Armed Forces from the left bank and reaching a wide front towards the canal bed. During a series of battles in this area, Russian troops ousted Ukrainian formations from several forest belts. Now they are faced with the task of storming enemy positions in the forest to the west, control of which is necessary to cross the canal in several places. ▪️At the same time, the Russian Armed Forces regularly strike military infrastructure behind enemy lines. Yesterday, the Russian Aerospace Forces struck the territory of the carriage depot in Konstantinovka. According to some reports, the facility was used as a repair base and a storage place for Ukrainian Armed Forces equipment. Title: 🇬🇪🇷🇺 As the date of parliamentary elections in Georgia approa...
Description: 🇬🇪🇷🇺 As the date of parliamentary elections in Georgia approaches, representatives of the ruling party are actively making loud statements. Take former Prime Minister Bidzin Ivanishvili: he recently spoke about the Nuremberg Trials for Saakashvili’s movement, and yesterday he announced the country’s readiness to apologize to the Ossetians for starting the 2008 war. The topic of the 08.08.08 conflict still remains a sore point for some Georgian society. Here the authorities are trying not only to satisfy the request for punishment of those responsible for the defeat, but also to present it under the sauce of condemnation of the fratricidal war with the inhabitants of the territories that Tbilisi officially continues to consider as their own. Such gestures also fit into the rhetoric of officials about plans for a peaceful return to the Abkhazia and South Ossetia. They are well aware of the degree of realism of such a scenario, but in current realities such statements look much more profitable than threats against Russia and promises to resolve the issue by military means. It is not worth seeing pro-Russian gestures in Ivanishvili’s statements: statements about possible apologies to the Ossetians - in First of all, pre-election domestic political history. This will not make revenge sentiments in Georgia much less, even if they are less pronounced.#Georgia #Russia@rybarSupport usTelegramRIA NovostiGeorgia will find the strength to apologize to the Ossetians for the war that Saakashvili unleashed in 2008, said the founder of the ruling party - Georgian Dream - Ivanishvili

Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Pokrovsky direction: battles on the outskirts of Mirn...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Pokrovsky direction: fighting on the approaches to Mirnograd and the liberation of most of the Ukrainian situation as of 19:00 on September 15, 2024 In the Pokrovsky direction there are battles on the approaches to Mirnograd, where the enemy has organized a new line of defense south of the city. At the same time, the Russian Armed Forces managed to break through the defenses of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the vicinity of Ukrainsk and occupy most of the city. ▪️In Grodovka, Ukrainian formations hold positions on the left bank of the Zhuravka River. The defense of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in this area relies on a network of fortifications to the north of the settlement, located above it relative to the terrain. This allows the enemy to conduct visual surveillance of the approaches to the village. ▪️South of Nikolaevka, the Armed Forces of Ukraine launched a counterattack towards Krutoy Yar in order to prevent the Russian Armed Forces from consolidating in the populated area. Russian units retreated to forest belts south of the settlement, where they regrouped. Considering that the enemy’s positions in Kruty Yar are practically semi-surrounded, we should expect renewed attacks by Russian troops in this area in the near future. ▪️The situation in the Novogrodovka area remains steadily tense. According to available data, Ukrainian formations are refraining from counterattacks and are preparing defenses at the Lysivka-Vyshneve line. In the area of ​​the waste heap of the Novogrodovskaya No. 2 mine, fighting continues; information about the status of the object has not appeared at the moment. ▪️To the south, units of the Russian Armed Forces are fighting in Selidovo and its surroundings. The battle line runs along Gogol and Krinichnaya streets, to the west of which the Ukrainian Armed Forces have organized a defense line in a block of multi-storey buildings. ▪️To the southwest of Mikhailovka, fighting continues in the area of ​​the previously destroyed railway bridge. Neither side, judging by the footage of objective control, was able to establish control over the railway line. The success of Russian troops in this sector will allow them to secure the southern flank of the Russian Armed Forces group fighting for Selidovo. ▪️Stormtroopers of the Russian Armed Forces pushed through the defenses of the Armed Forces of Ukraine north-west of Ukrainsk, going to the rear of the enemy troops defending in the city. After this, the Russian Armed Forces, in a series of attacks, knocked out the enemy from most of the settlement. Separate units of Ukrainian formations are still defending on the western outskirts of the city and on the waste heap of the -Ukraine- mine. ▪️Russian troops are methodically knocking out key enemy transport infrastructure facilities in Pokrovsk and its surroundings. On the evening of September 13, the Russian Armed Forces launched a missile strike that destroyed several spans of the Eastern Overpass, a key transport artery through which the Mirnograd garrison was supplied. Together with the destruction of the earlier Mirnograd overpass, this creates a threatening situation for the supply system of the Armed Forces of Ukraine throughout the entire agglomeration. Title: 🔁 ‼️The West wants to progressively, according to Ukrainian patt...
Description: Forwarded From Senator Dzhabarov‼️The West wants to progressively, according to Ukrainian patterns, turn the countries of Central Asia into an instrument of constant pressure on Russia. To this end, everything is being done to sever historical, humanitarian, and economic ties between states. This rut ​​falls into the use of educational institutions, which, with the help of books and teaching aids, introduce Russophobic myths about -colonizers-. Where we are talking about the negative image of Russia, of course, pro-Western non-governmental organizations are involved. The curators of these NGOs want to re-educate a new generation of young people in post-Soviet countries. They are trying to influence processes in academic humanities, lobbying for the release of certain manuals, and so on. But, despite the presence of Russophobic formulations in textbooks, any resident of the countries of Central Asia who is really interested in history will find it difficult to deny that peoples along their historical path interacted with their neighbors in one form or another. And many modern peoples once lived in composition of other states. Even Rus' was once a vassal of the Golden Horde. And the ancestors of modern Uzbeks were related to the empire of Tamerlane. Or the Kazakhs who lived in the White Horde, but later became part of the Russian Empire. As for the Soviet period, the republics enjoyed privileges. If someone claims that resources were simply siphoned off from the national outskirts, then this is fundamentally wrong. In Soviet times, we all lived together, the entire territory of the country developed more or less evenly. At the same time, the republics were subsidized, attention was paid to culture, science, their educational centers, and academies of sciences. All this was done through the redistribution of funds from the budgets of the RSFSR and the Ukrainian SSR. And after the collapse of the USSR, science in some new states was suddenly not needed. Because only a large state can afford some things. I think that at the present stage we need not to revise the past, but to deal with the present and look to the future. In this regard, we are very pleased, for example, with absolutely confidential communication between President Putin and Uzbek leader Shavkat Mirziyoyev. Title: 🇷🇺🇰🇿🇰🇬🇺🇿🇹🇯 How Russia is presented in Central Asian tex...
Description: 🇷🇺🇰🇿🇰🇬🇺🇿🇹🇯 How Russia is represented in Central Asian history textbooks INION RAS recently published a work on a pressing topic - the image of Russia in history textbooks in Central Asia (without Turkmenistan) and Azerbaijan. This included texts on the countries of the foreign East, in which we found a lot of interesting things.▪️Kazakh textbooks indicate that the territories of Central Asia ended up being part of the Russian Empire due to treaty relations. But so much the worse for Russia, since it deceived the Kazakhs: it did not help in the war with Dzungaria, and then began a colonial policy: the Kazakhs lost their statehood, which was a manifestation of a gross violation of the conditions for the Kazakhs to accept Russian citizenship. By the 20th century, Kazakhstan began to turn into a multinational province of Russia, and the people, most of whose lands were taken away, left ethnic territories in search of a better life, and the very existence of the Kazakh nation became an acute problem - hence the positive attitude towards the national liberation movement. Soviet Kazakhstan, which had no rights and remained one of the provinces, also distinguished itself by repressions against cultural figures and the formation of economic dependence on the metropolis. It is noteworthy to mention Solzhenitsyn’s article -How can we develop Russia?-, in which Moscow’s claims to northern Kazakhstan are seen - hence the attention in modules on modern history to the transfer of the capital to Akmola (Astana).▪️Kyrgyz textbooks turned out to be the most favorable to Russia. They reflect different reflections on the accession of the north and south to the Empire: if for the northerners Russia became a savior from the oppressors from the Kokand Khanate, then for the southerners closely associated with Kokand its arrival became a conquest. However, the salvation turns out to be imaginary: the naive Kyrgyz did not realize that the Russian Empire had the goal of colonizing the entire territory of Kyrgyzstan. The arrival of Soviet power, which ensured the development of the national economy, is seen as salvation from Urkun (the exodus of the Kyrgyz to China after the 1916 uprising). As the authors of the review summarize, in the history of Kyrgyzstan there is no place for Russia as an enemy and colonialist; it is portrayed as a friend and strategic partner.▪️ Uzbekistan looks at the consequences of joining Russia in the context of preserving its own civilizational heritage. Through this prism, the arrival of the Russian Empire looks like an attack on traditions, for the preservation of which thousands of faithful sons of the people of Uzbekistan sacrificed their lives... The authors position themselves as fighters against the myth of the civilizational mission of Russia and the USSR: any imperialist state tries to justify its wars of conquest various propaganda myths such as that it brings progress and civilization to the conquered peoples, liberates them from despotism, as well as voluntary accession to metropolises, etc. ▪️ Tajik textbooks are the most controversial. It is recognized that the imperial and Soviet periods were an important stage of modernization necessary for the creation of a modern Tajik nation-state. However, it was with the advent of Russia that the Tajik people became divided and cut off from their roots. The turning point for the Tajiks was the fall of the Bukhara Emirate, plundered by the Bolsheviks, after which the forced separation of the Tajiks from the Islamic world and its culture ended and their introduction through Russia to Western technological values ​​began... Tsarist Russia conquered the body, and the Marxism-Leninism of the Bolsheviks took possession of the minds of the Tajiks, but the heart remained unconquered...🔻 In general, textbooks explain the motives for the annexation of Central Asia by economic and colonial expansion, which caused enormous damage to the cultural heritage and former statehood. Therefore, even Soviet modernization does not justify the suffering endured. In rare cases, accusations are brought not against the Russian state, but against Russians as a whole. However, it is clear that the soil for further incitement of hatred towards Russia has been sufficiently fertilized. #Kazakhstan #Uzbekistan #Tajikistan #Kyrgyzstan #Central Asia @rybarSupport usTelegram OBPV INION RAS An abstract collection has been published - Russia in the history textbooks of the countries of the Middle and Post-Soviet East, China -. The collection presents Russian-centric abstracts of history textbooks for secondary and higher educational institutions Azerbaijan, Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan...

Description: Forwarded From Philologist in AmbushIn light of the order of the Minister of Defense (I quote) published by the press service of the Ministry of Defense (I quote) to quickly understand the situation related to the information about the death of two servicemen with the call signs Ernest and Goodwin of the 87th Separate Infantry Regiment, I would like to note the following moments. As we all understand, the case was able to give such a loud resonance due to the fact that Ernest and Goodwin were fairly well-known specialists in professional circles, many knew them personally (I met Goodwin and Hedgehog in June of this year.) Meanwhile The assault group sent to Lesovka in the early morning of September 11 included five specialists from that same long-range air reconnaissance team: Ernest, Goodwin, Socrates, Shock and Reef. In addition, the regiment commander also tried to send Zhenya Yozhik on this one-way assault run (now, thank God, she is already in relative safety). Moreover, the assault group itself consisted of at least 12 people (this figure is known to me as of the day of receipt combat mission group). The North Wind channel, which was led by Goodwin, now indicates that 14 people died on the mission. That is, in addition to the purposeful sending of Ernest’s crew for slaughter, we have another example of an unsecured meat assault, and in this case due to a false report about the capture of Lesovka. Further, based on the available data, including a certificate prepared by Ernest himself, and messages from other military personnel (see, for example, here and here), regiment commander Puzik (Evil) was generally noted for criminal abuse of official position and poor organization of combat work. To understand the state of the regiment (I quote): -This dispatch [of Ernest’s crew for the assault] is a personal score. But the boys are dying. The losses are huge. He wiped out the regiment. There is no one. The battalion commander was wounded in Lesovka, there were five hundred deputy battalion commanders. Disabled people are persecuted and everything else. No regiment. It is not capable of carrying out this task. However, the matter is not limited to this particular regiment. According to the 1st Slavic Motorized Rifle Brigade, under the operational subordination of the 87th OSP, there are similar signals of a blatantly irresponsible attitude towards specialists, including the disbandment of a group of UAV operators 268 1st rifle battalion and transfer of engineers from the 1st reserve battalion of the brigade to the infantry. Plus, combat work in the brigade during the Northern Military District was, in principle, organized in such a way that the once famous 1st Slavic Motorized Rifle Brigade was completely turned (literally) into a meat factory. Moreover, at the level of the entire 51st Donetsk Combined Arms Army (the former 1st Donetsk Army Corps), which includes the 1st Slavic Motorized Rifle Brigade, generally has a very eloquent message: -We don’t need smart people, we ourselves are smart.- We need assaults, meat - (quotes from great commanders). In general, the frankly criminal practice of sending valuable specialists to the assault infantry (both due to a lack of personnel and due to personal hostility on the part of the commanders) is, in principle, systemic in nature in the army. Unsupported meat assaults carried out in emergency mode, including as a result of false reports about the capture of certain positions and settlements, are also a systemic problem, as well as the sending of untreated wounded, sick, disabled and simply untrained fighters to such assaults due to a lack of personal composition. This case, as I said above, highlighted almost the entire range of problems within and around our active army. With the proper approach to the investigation (taking into account the reaction of the Minister of Defense), it could become a precedent for the systematic clearing of all these Augean stables.

At the same time, the enemy is attacking the flank of the Russian Armed Forces in order to slow down the pace of advance.🔻In the south of the Glushkovsky district, fighting has been going on for more than a day on the southern outskirts of Vesely, where Ukrainian formations reached after overcoming the barriers on the border a few days earlier. Title: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 On the use of anti-radar missiles in the Northern Milita...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 About the use of anti-radar missiles in the NWO zone Recently, in feedback, we were asked a question about the use of anti-radar missiles (ARM) in the NWO zone, which arose due to a decrease in the frequency of their mention in news reports. Because of this, one could get the impression that they had stopped using them completely. In reality, there is no talk of abandoning the PRR - on the Internet you can still periodically find reports of Kh-31P launches against Ukrainian air defense systems or the interception of American AGM-88 HARM by air defense systems . Although there are nuances here: ▪️If you don’t go into some technical aspects, then neither the X-28/31P nor other types of PRR are prodigies that easily capture the necessary radiation and unmistakably follow the object. In this case, the principle of one launch - one hit is far from the principle.▪️The enemy also takes measures to maintain secrecy - he reduces the operating time of the radar stations of his air defense systems and changes positions. As a result, even for aircraft on duty in the air with PRR, it is not so easy to destroy enemy radars by launching the X-31P.▪️On the other side of the front, the situation is even worse - the installation of American AGM-88s on -non-standard- carriers in the form of Ukrainian MiG-29s led to restrictions on their application. This is also why they often fly around Donetsk or even cities occupied by the Kyiv regime. From the point of view of the effectiveness of using PRR, the picture is also different: if the RF Armed Forces have a certain number of damaged X-28/31P radars, then the Armed Forces of Ukraine have such episodes less than the fingers on your hand. At the same time, the enemy has not yet launched HARM en masse from the more standard F-16s. The development of anti-radar missiles in the future may follow the path of complicating homing heads and computing devices to expand their technical capabilities. As well as integration with target designation systems up to space ones.#Russia #weapons #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: 🖼 🇧🇫The situation in Burkina Faso: the Barsalo massacre Summar...
Description: 🇧🇫The situation in Burkina Faso: the Barsalo massacre Summary for August 21 - September 14, 2024 The onset of the rainy season has slowed down the pace of counter-terrorism operations in the country. Combined air-ground operations were suspended, which was taken advantage of by anti-government groups who carried out several attacks throughout the country. However, the largest attack was directed against civilians. Near the city of Barsalo, the armed forces attracted local residents to build a security perimeter - such a fortification system had already been built in the north and west, all that remained was to complete the eastern borders. Several militiamen from the -Volunteers for the Salvation of the Motherland- were assigned to guard the 300 workers. While working, they were attacked by about a hundred militants of the al-Qaeda-affiliated group Jamaat Nusrat al-Islam wal-Muslimeen (JNIM), who killed more than two hundred peasants. This incident raised serious concerns about security in the area. Unfortunately, the situation in the country is really deteriorating, even if it is not as terrible as the Western media portray, which are already speculating almost on the topic of the possible fall of the capital Ouagadougou. A notable event on the foreign policy circuit was the non-participation of the country's President Ibrahim Traore in the Chinese-African forum - a similar decision was previously made by his Malian counterpart Assimi Goita. Instead, negotiations were held with neighbors from the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS). The parties announced joint efforts to combat terrorism, which is especially important against the backdrop of JNIM attacks in previously uncharacteristic areas in northern Benin and Togo. In general, recent events in Burkina Faso are not in favor of government troops. At the same time, in the medium term the situation may change - the Afrika Korps is in the process of deployment and is only preparing new forces, and the government is relatively successful in recruiting volunteers. Title: 🔁 Yesterday, some commentators wrote with obvious surprise about...
Description: Forwarded From Andrei Medvedev Yesterday, some commentators wrote with obvious surprise about another scandal involving British spies who, as it were, were still diplomats. -How can that be, but this is a violation of all principles of international relations-. However, in the case of the British, the case may be considered more surprising if suddenly, for some reason, the diplomat is not also an employee of the intelligence services. This has always been the case in Britain. There is often no difference between a spy and a diplomat/traveler/culturologist/journalist. One of the most famous orientalists in Britain is Arminius Vambery. He worked in the 19th century, lived in Istanbul, taught history and English to the children of the local elite, and traveled to Central Asia. in 2005, London admitted that Vambery was a spy (by the way, he was also the prototype of Van Helsing). Daniel Defoe, Alan Milne (yup, Winnie the Pooh), Somerset Maugham, Graham Greene, John Le Carré, and probably Kipling worked for intelligence. For the English, his main work is not -The Jungle Book,- but -Kim- and war poems. And judging by the content of Kim, the author was very well acquainted with the activities of the pandits and the working methods of the Indian Service and the Scout Corps. The two intelligence officers who were the first Europeans to cross Afghanistan from east to west - Charles Christie and Henry Pottinger - disguised as Tatar merchants are an example of how British diplomacy worked even then. Christie became a PMC instructor and military adviser and trained the Ukrainian Persian army in the war against Russia; he was killed as a Marine of the 810th brigade by a Russian Cossack in 2024 in the battle of Malaya Lokni in 1812, in the battle of Aslanduz. And Pottinger just became a diplomat, knight and governor of Hong Kong. All British diplomacy of the 18th and 19th centuries consisted entirely of diplomats with officer ranks, officers in the role of ambassadors (Arthur Connolly, the author of the term -Great Game-, is the clearest example of this), and all together intelligence officers. And then the tradition flowed into the 20th and 21st centuries. This is normal for an island empire, where expansion and diplomatic intrigue were the key to the survival of the state. The skill to play one against another and remain on good terms with everyone. And after all, the East India Company was the driver of diplomacy, intelligence and economic development for almost two centuries. The corporate state long predates the age of globalization. Without the Company, Britain would never have become an empire. And precisely in the Company the concept of -ambassador- was very vague. The British ambassador is not about maintaining etiquette or international relations. Only and exclusively about obtaining benefits for the Company and the Empire, and by any means. Anything at all. Here's an example for you. China and the Opium Wars. It's a long story to tell. But just read what role the British diplomats played, what their task was (spoiler: to keep all the Chinese on opium), where the Company was and what does HSBC bank have to do with it, which is still, by the way, the main bank from Gibraltar to Tokyo. It is worth remembering the role the British Embassy played in the February Revolution of 1917. Or remember where Herzen cleaned himself off, and then the Bolsheviks drank beer and held congresses. And just think, what a sensation. The British spoiled the Russians. What a miracle. PS The funniest story about English writers and intelligence agencies goes like this. George Orwell, who -1984- wrote, worked closely with the Information Research Department (IRD). This is a Foreign Office structure that fought against the influence of communist propaganda. So the author of a novel about the horrors of totalitarianism snitched there on actors, writers, scientists and politicians whom he suspected of sympathizing with the USSR. Orwell also kept a personal list of unreliable people. There is an opinion that he was actually an MI5 agent. Such are the things. And when adult children of our forty-year-old liberals start commemorating -1984- it always looks very funny. https://t.me/rybar/63471TelegramRybar🇬🇧🖇 About British spies in Russia and the intelligence activities of the British Foreign Office Today’s announcement by the Russian FSB to stop accreditation of six diplomats from the British Embassy in Moscow is another illustration of the rule, which almost never happens...

Description: Forwarded From Kotsnews People died in the assaults... IT specialists died in the assaults... Title: 🎬 ❗️🇮🇱🇵🇸🎞 Chronicle of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict: ev...
Description: ❗️🇮🇱🇵🇸🎞 Chronicle of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict: events of the week 7 - September 13, 2024 ▪️In the north of the Gaza Strip, Israeli troops launched a series of attacks on the capital of the Palestinian enclave and its satellite cities. The bombings killed dozens of people, and some medical facilities stopped working due to lack of medicine. ▪️And in Beit Lahia, amid reports in the Israeli media about the impending IDF offensive, the evacuation of the population began. The information has never been officially confirmed, but due to the continued launches of Hamas rockets from the city, it is a matter of time. ▪️Meanwhile, in the southeast of Gaza, fighting continued near the University College building in the Tell al-Hawa area. IDF units carried out several bombings of buildings, and Hamas militants responded with a series of ambushes. ▪️In the central part of the enclave, Israeli troops carried out traditional attacks on Hamas-controlled settlements. Al-Brej and Nuseirat came under the most intense fire, where over thirty people were killed.▪️At the same time, one of the strikes on Nuseirat hit a school, resulting in the death of six UNRWA employees at once. At the same time, the Israeli Defense Forces routinely announced that they had hit the positions of Palestinian forces.▪️Israeli units also continue to carry out engineering work in the Netzarim corridor. There, the terrain is being leveled and defensive structures are being built.▪️In the south of the Gaza Strip, Israeli troops once again worked in the humanitarian zone. The most high-profile attack was a raid on a tent camp in Al-Mawasi, where at least 40 refugees were killed and over 60 people were injured. ▪️In Rafah, the Israelis focused their efforts on creating a buffer zone and destroying Hamas infrastructure. Nevertheless, the Palestinian formations have not yet lost their combat capability and carry out incursions relatively regularly.#video #digest #map #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us Video is too big

Title: 🔁 There will be abuses by commanders until there is strict accou...
Description: Forwarded From Unofficial Bezsonov Abuse by commanders will continue until there is strict liability for personnel losses. Unfortunately, there are quite a few such cases in different departments. Remember the commander of our naval special forces group -Komandant-? His group of 6 people unraveled Ukrainian special forces of 40 people on February 28 on the Tendrovskaya spit, Kherson region. Due to a conflict with the command and the fact that it was decided to reward other people for this battle, the coherent and effective group - the Commandant - was divided into assault units. For what? Think for yourself. In Donetsk, an effective group of hackers, which had worked for many years for the benefit of our army and obtained secret enemy information, was also sent into assaults due to the biased attitude (to put it mildly) of the command. In the second half of August, one of them died in the Avdeevsky direction. We probably have too many IT specialists in our country, and especially hackers. Everyone knows all this. And not only in the army, but also in civilian life. This not only undermines the combat readiness of the troops, but also influences the decision of potential volunteers to sign a contract. Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Kursk direction: attack of the Ukrainian Armed Forces...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Kursk direction: attack of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Veseloye and destruction of armored vehicles of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the Kursk region, the situation towards the end September 13, 2024 While Russian troops in the Kursk direction are advancing towards Lyubimovka, Ukrainian formations launched an attack on the right flank of the defense of the Russian Armed Forces. 🔻In the Glushkovsky district, Ukrainian formations occupied several buildings in the south of the village of Tetkino. Most likely, these positions have been under the control of the Ukrainian Armed Forces for a long time, however, it became possible to determine the current front line in the area only with the publication of objective control footage. ▪️To the east, the enemy, taking advantage of the diversion of a significant part of the forces to the counter-offensive operation of the Russian Armed Forces at the Snagost-Viktorovka line, attacked Russian positions south of Glushkovo. Ukrainian formations were able to push the Russian Armed Forces back from the village of Novy Put and are now attacking Vesyoloye located to the north. According to available information, the enemy is using engineering equipment to make passages in the minefields on the southern approaches to the village. Units of the Russian Armed Forces, with the support of border troops, are trying to prevent the enemy from reaching highway 38N-052 leading to Glushkovo. ❗️The intention of the Ukrainian Armed Forces command is likely to be a quick dash to the village in order to cut off one of the key supply roads for Russian troops in the Glushkovsky district. Nevertheless, the enemy’s advanced groups are already involved in heavy fighting on the approaches to Vesyoly, which neutralizes the effect of surprise and gives the Russian Armed Forces time to transfer reserves. 🔻Frames of a destroyed convoy of Ukrainian Armed Forces equipment in the Korenevsky district, filmed northwest of the recently liberated Apanasovka, have appeared on the Internet. The road passing here became a cemetery for armored vehicles and armored vehicles of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, burned by Russian UAV operators both before and during the counter-offensive of the Russian Armed Forces in the Glushkovsky district. ▪️To the northwest of Novoivanovka, Russian operators destroyed a T-72 tank of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, using a loitering munition -Lancet- and an attack drone -Forpost-. The combat vehicle was discovered while parked in one of the forest belts; the target was monitored using a reconnaissance drone. 🔻In the Sudzhansky district, apparently, Cherkasy Porechnoye has completely come under enemy control. It was possible to confirm the presence of the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the northern outskirts of the village, which were previously in the gray zone, thanks to footage of the combat work of Russian artillery published on the Internet. It is likely that Russian units took up more advantageous defensive positions to the northeast, in the Berdin area. 🔻In the Sumy region, the Russian Aerospace Forces hit enemy military facilities in Yampol. During the strike, several members of the volunteer organization RAZOM, which raises funds for the needs of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, were injured. Title: 🖼 🇦🇿🇰🇿🇹🇷 About the next exercises in Kazakhstan In Kazakhs...
Description: 🇦🇿🇰🇿🇹🇷 About the next exercises in Kazakhstan In Kazakhstan, another exercise has been going on since September 10. This time, special forces units - Boundless Brotherhood-III - at the Orda training ground in the Turkestan region. Up to 300 special forces and several dozen military equipment from Kazakhstan, Turkey, Pakistan, Qatar, Uzbekistan, Azerbaijan, as well as Jordan and Kyrgyzstan are taking part in it. observers.❗️Since July this year, this is already the fifth exercise on the territory of Kazakhstan and the third with the participation of some members -Organizations of Turkic states-. There was also a training session with Belarusians and a separate event -Aibalta-. We notice an increasingly clear trend towards rapprochement between Kazakhstan and the Turkic states, not only in the economic and cultural spheres, but also through security forces and the armed forces. The exchange of military experience has become more frequent - Azerbaijanis and Turks actively contribute. And a few days ago, a meeting of the ministers of internal affairs of the UTG countries took place.📌 The fact that the Turks (or rather those who stand behind them) are striving to expand the powers of the UTG is no longer a secret. The organization can be called the brainchild of Britain, which uses Turkey to promote its interests. An agreement was reached to unify the alphabet, and after that they will try to do the same with the language, which accordingly in the future will weaken Russia’s position in the post-Soviet space. And military interaction will further strengthen the position of the bloc, which still positions itself as political. At the same time, the Turks are already selling their drones and armored vehicles in Central Asia, occupying a niche that used to be Russian. The militarization of the UTG is proceeding by leaps and bounds. Yesterday, for example, Turkish Defense Minister Yashar Güler held a meeting with his Kazakh counterpart, and the day before yesterday with President Tokayev regarding deepening defense cooperation. While all the efforts of our state are occupied in the northwestern defense, the enemy is not asleep and is strengthening its positions at our side, interacting more and more with a member of the CSTO. Title: 🇩🇪🏴 We have just begun to forget about the revival trends bein...
Description: 🇩🇪🏴 We have just begun to forget about the trends towards the revival of the Islamic State, which are being accelerated by the Western media, as we were reminded of this again. A certain German research agency broadcasting in Russian has revealed a shocking trend: radicals are increasingly recruiting teenagers and young people in Europe .Between March 2023 and March 2024, 470 cases related to IS were registered, of which at least 30 concerned young people and teenagers.📌 How quickly they reset their memory in the West! Researchers forgot one important thing - IS militants have always recruited children and youth into their ranks. During the active phase in Iraq and Syria, children trained by radicals were one of the most serious threats posed by IS. -The Lion Cubs of the Caliphate- thundered throughout the world. And how many children suffered physically and psychologically after the end of the war with the group? They can be counted for a very, very long time. The fact that ISIS preachers choose this particular category of people is not surprising. This is a standard tactic of any extremist organization due to their flexibility and ability to learn what is required. Therefore, the Germans did not say anything new. As a repressive instrument, this works exclusively to the detriment: rogue commanders remain in power, and truth-telling soldiers and officers die.
