Title: 🔁🖼 In the interests of the West, Ukraine continues to develop t...
Description: Forwarded From Two MajorsIn the interests of the West in Ukraine  continue to develop the sphere of railway transportation on the section Chop - Uzhgorod  (near the borders with 🇭🇺Hungary and 🇸🇰Slovakia) work began on preparing the ground for laying Eurogauge (1435 mm). By July 2025, 22 km of railway track will be built, reconstruction of artificial structures, facilities and utility networks, and a European signaling system will be carried out. The 🇪🇺EU Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Fund paid 50% (15.7 million euros) of the cost of the entire project. Investments go towards development  logistics hubs on routes with the EU. On the territory of the Vinnitsa urban community, construction is underway of a dry port - a railway terminal connecting the central regions of Ukraine with the ports of Odessa and through the container terminal - Mostyksky - (Lviv region, owned by the oligarch Akhmetov) with EU countries. At the first stage (autumn 2024), railway infrastructure and the first container site with a throughput capacity of about 30 thousand TEU per year will be built. Investments in the project amounted to $15 million. The logistics hub itself  -Mostyksky - will be complemented by a new container platform with a transition gauge of 1520 mm - 1435 mm, as well as a portal container crane on rails RMG. Earlier, in June 2023, pumping stations were already installed at Mostyksky, allowing for the transshipment of large volumes of liquid cargo from cars to railway tanks and from railway tanks from 1520 mm tracks to tanks on 1435 mm tracks. European Bank for Reconstruction and Development&nbsp ; (EBRD) in August announced an international tender for the purchase of 10 battery-powered shunting locomotives for Ukrzaliznytsia (UZ). In June 2024, as part of the program to update the locomotive fleet, the EBRD announced a loan of 300 million euros to UZ for the purchase of electric freight locomotives. At the beginning of 2024, the World Bank allocated $190 million to UZ for the acquisition  80 electric freight locomotives. These purchases made it possible to identify Ukraine’s needs for dual-system electric locomotives (DC/AC), including 25 kV, with a maximum operating speed of up to 120 km/h. The lack of trained personnel is also an acute issue, especially against the backdrop of the fierce mobilization of the male population. In addition, the US Agency for International Development (USAID) provided 300 grain wagons to Ukrainian exporters. It is significant that Ukraine is actively using grain carriers and agricultural facilities  for the transportation and storage of military equipment supplied by Western countries through grain export channels (-alternative grain corridor-, -solidarity routes-). USAID is also preparing a feasibility study for the construction of the Bereshty multimodal logistics complex in 🇲🇩Moldova, which is designed to move cargo to Ukraine.✨Western investments in railway infrastructure are colossal and are associated primarily with commercial interests in the export of Ukrainian agricultural products and other resources. At the same time, NATO countries plan to use these routes to transfer their military cargo, equipment and personnel to the Russian direction.-Drang nach Osten 2.0-Two majors

Title: 🇦🇿🗳 About the results of the parliamentary elections in Azerba...
Description: 🇦🇿🗳 About the results of the parliamentary elections in Azerbaijan While the Central Election Commission of Azerbaijan is counting the final results (it has a maximum of 20 days for this) and transfers them to the Constitutional Court for final verification and approval (for this it has a maximum of 10 more days), the main political results can be summed up voting took place on Sunday.▪️Firstly, a decrease in voter turnout in parliamentary elections is becoming a trend. At the same time, three-quarters of voters or more come to the presidential elections. In this way, it is emphasized that Azerbaijan is not an oil sultanate, but a democratic state, and, secondly, its place in relation to the President is clearly indicated to the legislative branch.▪️ Regarding the new composition of the parliament, one can clearly say - all the same in the arena - with the clarification that they have appeared some new figures, such as the famous Soviet actor and experienced Azerbaijani ambassador to Moscow Polad Bulbul oglu, who was elected from Karabakh. Saghiba Gafarova will most likely remain at the head of the parliament and continue her international activities, essentially being the second Minister of Foreign Affairs of Azerbaijan (a minister with a female face).▪️In the new parliament there will be 10 instead of 8 opposition parties, with most of them as and in 2020 it will be represented only by the party leader. That is, the formal opposition will be 13 instead of 10 deputies. The ruling party - New Azerbaijan - will have 68 seats instead of 70.▪️According to the Central Election Commission, about 50,000 people could vote in Karabakh (in February, just over 20,000). The basis of the electorate in Karabakh were specially brought there - refugees from the occupied territories - and - forced migrants -.▪️Predictably, the elections were not recognized by the opposition and were characterized by skepticism by the West. But both of them look somehow toothless. The opposition National Council of Azerbaijan, in particular, considers the elections illegitimate, since the authorities did not allow the PACE delegation to conduct an observation mission at the elections and banned 76 members of the assembly from entering Azerbaijan. And the OSCE/ODIHR notes in its preliminary statement that the elections took place in a restrictive political and legal environment that does not contribute to genuine pluralism, and led to a fight devoid of competition. At the same time, all international organizations friendly to Azerbaijan, such as the CIS, SCO, Organization Turkic states, the Non-Aligned Movement (which has been living on Azerbaijan's money in recent years), the Parliamentary Assembly of the Black Sea Economic Cooperation and other elections were recognized as almost flawless. 🔻To summarize, we can say that the Azerbaijani authorities successfully held the first parliamentary elections throughout the country, received deputies in the parliament who will now legally represent the interests not of refugees from Karabakh as before, but of the population of Karabakh (even if brought), that is a significant trump card in the negotiation process. #Azerbaijan #elections@rybarSupport usTelegramRybar🇦🇿🗳 Today, early elections to the National Assembly are being held in Azerbaijan. Title: 🌍🇨🇳 About the China-Africa Forum While the eighth Forum is jus...
Description: 🌍🇨🇳 About the China-Africa Forum While the eighth China-Africa Cooperation Forum is just beginning in Beijing, it may seem early to talk about any results. But in fact, all the main events happened even before the opening.▪️Malian leader Assimi Goita held negotiations with African colleagues, and also managed to sign an agreement on the purchase of Chinese-made armored vehicles. ▪️The PRC authorities also managed to negotiate with other representatives of states. These are the presidents of Eritrea, DR Congo, Djibouti, Central African Republic, Comoros, Togo, as well as the foreign ministers of Burkina Faso, South Africa and Senegal. The presence of Congolese leader Felix Tshisekedi is especially noteworthy. On the one hand, the words of the Hospitaller medic indirectly confirm that the scale of enemy losses is much higher than the official figures of the Kyiv regime. In this particular case, the information about the death of over 200 members of the Armed Forces of Ukraine is really more like the truth, and not elephant radio. Also, the eyewitness account again illustrates that the situation with medical care is worse than is sometimes believed in the Russian blogosphere - there are very familiar people in the text moments about poor-quality turnstiles and inability to provide first aid.❗️It is important to emphasize: the latter is another reason to learn from other people’s mistakes. It is no secret that in domestic law enforcement agencies many people still (!) perceive the words -tourniquet-, -bandage- and -bandage-tamponade- as French curses, not to mention the MARCH protocols (or its analogue KULAK-BARIN). This became possible immediately after the capture of several large strongholds located along the highway, after which the Ukrainian Armed Forces were forced to roll back in the direction of Vodyanoy.▪️In the latter there are currently battles going on, as well as on the approaches to the industrial zone. At the moment, the front runs along the Kashgalach River. ▪️At the same time, the presence of the Armed Forces of Ukraine still remains on the approaches to Novomayorsky, located west of Prechistovka. Title: 🇬🇧 On increasing energy taxes in the UK In October, the Chancel...
Description: 🇬🇧 On increasing energy taxes in the UK In October, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will announce details of the British budget for next year. The politician will outline plans for the development of the country's financial sector and how they will affect the lives of citizens. Of course, on the eve of such an important event we should expect increased activity by large British businesses. Energy companies have already taken action. Their representatives are trying to put pressure on the government before adopting a new budget. According to the authorities' decision, from November 1, the tax on excess profits from energy resources will increase from 35% to 38%. At the same time, companies operating in the North Sea pay 30% corporation tax, as well as an additional levy of 10%. Representatives of these companies said that the implementation of the British government's plan to increase the excess profits tax would lead to a loss of revenue of 12 billion pounds. sterling and will put about 35,000 jobs at risk due to their abandonment of some projects. Following this, the Norwegian oil and gas company Neo Energy suspended work on a large oil field in the North Sea, citing the prospect of higher taxes and stricter environmental regulations.🔻Despite pressure from British business, the government will have to make a difficult decision and increase taxes. Description: 🇬🇧🇺🇸 About cooperation between Great Britain and the USA in the nuclear field  Washington and London decided to indefinitely extend the mutual defense agreement, which defines joint activities in the field of using nuclear energy for defensive purposes. The agreement was concluded in 1958 and has since been extended several times, most recently in 2014. The document defines the procedure for the exchange technologies and results of nuclear research. The signing of the agreement is primarily due to the fact that the United States and Great Britain are modernizing their strategic offensive forces. The process requires a lot of time and money. The British Ministry of Defense forecasts that the budget of the organization that oversees modernization will grow by 62% to about 100 billion pounds over the next decade. Along with this, according to the latest estimates from the US Congressional Budget Office, a similar program designed for approximately 30 years will cost taxpayers $75 billion. The extension of the agreement is further evidence that the US and UK, under the pretext of threats from Russia and China, and strategic deterrence will continue to carry out activities to absorb growing military budgets. At least the legal basis for this has been laid for decades to come.#Great Britain #USA @rybar together with @oldGBRSupport usProject -Rybar-Why are the Americans returning nuclear weapons to the UK? Title: 🔁 📚 On September 3, 1945, Victory Day over the Militarists was ...
Description: Forwarded From Topics. The main thing (GlavMedia)📚 On September 3, 1945, Victory Day over militaristic Japan was declared in the Soviet Union - the event that put an end to World War II - the bloodiest military campaign in human history. For many years, the post-war world order was determined within the framework of the Yalta-Potsdam system of international relations, and the historical facts recorded in the documents of the Nuremberg, Tokyo and Khabarovsk tribunals were considered indisputable. But a drop wears away a stone: sadly, myths about the Second World War today prevail in Western, Japanese, and, more recently, in Russian society. On the eve of the 79th anniversary of the Victory over Japan, a very useful monograph was published - The Main Directions of Falsification events of the Second World War by foreign politicians, historians, and the media. Title: 🖼 🇮🇳🇰🇿🇺🇿🇹🇯 How will the transport corridor from India af...
Description: 🇮🇳🇰🇿🇺🇿🇹🇯 How will the transport corridor from India affect Central Asia? While the Central Asian countries are making logistics routes through Afghanistan to Pakistan, India is laying out its own route through Iran and Turkmenistan. The first 20 containers have already arrived in Uzbekistan, as reported by Turkmen railway workers. Moreover, this route only partially uses the infrastructure of the MTC -North-South-. The corridor from India to Central Asia also became one of the topics at the meeting of the foreign ministers of all five countries on August 28-29 in New Delhi - this is the first meeting in such a format. And in the fall, the second summit of the leaders of India and the states of Central Asia is expected to take place. New Delhi’s intentions are clear: it does not want to depend either on unstable Afghanistan or on its old geopolitical rival Islamabad, while at the same time getting the opportunity to cause trouble for Beijing. Iran finds itself at the crossroads of several trade routes at once, while Washington does not even impose sanctions against the port of Chabahar, where Indian cargo is delivered, not wanting to alienate New Delhi. 🔻For Russia, this is a case with a rather controversial effect, requiring careful analysis and skillful diplomacy. Because, on the one hand, it creates opportunities to counterbalance Chinese influence in the region, which is growing as the One Belt, One Road initiative is implemented. On the other hand, this corridor fulfills the task that was set in Washington a month ago - to make Central Asia less dependent on Russia and China by providing it with an alternative trade route. Title: 🇲🇳🇷🇺 About Vladimir Putin’s visit to Mongolia On the evening ...
Description: 🇲🇳🇷🇺 About Vladimir Putin’s visit to Mongolia On the evening of September 2, Vladimir Putin arrived in Mongolia for a visit. The official purpose of the trip is to participate in commemorative events in honor of the victory on the Khalkhin Gol River. During the trip, the Mongolian and Russian sides also discussed issues of bilateral cooperation. Agreements were signed in the field of supply of petroleum products, aviation fuel and other documents. ▪️For many media and various types of observers, two issues overshadowed the other results of the negotiations - the Power of Siberia-2 gas pipeline and Ulaanbaatar’s failure to comply with the provisions of the Rome Statute and the requirements of the ICC. Hints of the promotion of the latter topic are visible in the accounts of diplomatic representatives of Western countries in Mongolia. And some media outlets with connections to USAID even explain in their videos why the Mongols would like, but cannot, arrest Vladimir Putin. Speaking about the Power of Siberia-2, it is worth remembering that in August, according to the Chinese press, Mongolia did not include the gas pipeline planned for construction in the national development plan until 2028. Many agree that this happened due to the lack of effective agreements between Russia and China - for example, the parties have not yet reached a consensus on gas prices. Since the project is of particular importance, the topic of the gas pipeline was discussed at Russian-Mongolian negotiations. This is confirmed not only by Vladimir Putin’s statements, but also by the Russian President’s interview with the Mongolian publication Onoodor - in which he mentioned the possibility of Mongolia using transit gas for its own purposes. 🔻For Mongolia, Russia is one of the important foreign policy priorities. This is evidenced not only by the statements of politicians, but also by the economic situation. Ulaanbaatar has been dependent on Russian fuel supplies for quite some time. Against this background, Mongolia is actively implementing the so-called third neighbor policy, that is, developing relations not only with traditional partners in the person of Russia and China, but also with other countries that do not border Mongolian territory. First of all, we are talking about the USA, South Korea, Japan and the EU. For the resources of Mongolia, of which there are really many in the country, a real struggle is unfolding on the part of the countries of the West and East Asia. This is also due to requests from Mongolian enterprises actively seeking inflows of foreign investment. Given the speed with which Western NGOs, politicians and businesses are spreading their influence in the country, plans to develop cooperation between Mongolia and Russia may soon be in jeopardy. And, perhaps, the visit of the head of the Russian state will give impetus to correcting the current situation. #Mongolia #Russia@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport usPresident of RussiaDocuments signed following the negotiations between the presidents of Russia and Mongolia1. Title: 🇷🇺🇺🇦🪖 On the issues of the saturation of units with personne...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦🪖 On the issues of saturation of units with personnel and the number of armed forces The invasion of the Ukrainian Armed Forces into the Kursk region, when the enemy passed through small barriers with relative ease, made the topic of building up forces to cover the state border relevant. But this, in turn, is a special case of another extremely important issue - the current saturation of units with personnel. This topic has been discussed in the troops, to put it mildly, not for the first time. Without a sufficient number of people at the front, rotations are disrupted, not to mention the possibility of conducting offensive operations: there will simply be nothing to support the current pace of the offensive in the Donbass, and the front will freeze, as before the Kharkov offensive of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in September 2022. 📌 There is another side to the issue - without a large influx of fresh forces, the long-discussed partial demobilization of those called up in 2022 cannot be carried out. And there is a demand for it in society: so far there are no mass pickets of relatives of the mobilized, but the likelihood of their appearance will increase over time. And the enemy will definitely want to use them. The only way to resolve the issue of both replenishing units on the front line with personnel and simultaneously carrying out partial mobilization without losing the combat effectiveness of the armed forces is to ensure the influx of people into the army in greater numbers than they leave for a combination of reasons. Implementation this can be done using different methods. But there is an important point: you need to proceed from the fact that if any of the indicated methods does not ensure the completion of the task, then you should not engage in half-measures and drawing numbers in reports, but move on to the next one.❗️Yes, there are basically no easy solutions here. But ignoring the situation will lead to the fact that the enemy, by expanding the conscription (the people in the so-called Ukraine are far from finished), will be able to create a strong numerical superiority over our formations. And then we will have to take the same emergency measures to recruit people, but already in a much more unfavorable situation. How this happens can be recalled from the sad events of the fall of 2022. Which could have been avoided without postponing the necessary measures.#WSRF #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 About the likely course of actions of the Armed Force...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 About the likely course of actions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the Russian border region Against the backdrop of the enemy’s offensive in the Kursk region and its consolidation in the occupied territory, the possibility of new incursions into neighboring regions cannot be discounted.🔻In the Belgorod region, attempts by Ukrainian formations to cross the state border are recorded from time to time, however all of them turned out to be unsuccessful, even taking into account the involvement of relatively large forces. At first glance, the enemy is focused on ousting the RF Armed Forces from the sanitary zone in the Kharkov region. However, the front line in the sector has already frozen since the start of the operation of Russian troops, and the nature of the fighting has shifted to positional. The hottest spots remain Volchansk and Glubokoe, where the Ukrainian Armed Forces carry out attacks from time to time. At the same time, several attempted attacks were recorded in the area of ​​​​Kolotilovka, Nekhoteevka and Bezymeno in August alone. Almost always in the official media there were statements about the DRG, but in reality we are talking about attacks by entire companies with the support of armored vehicles. It can also be noted that the enemy is mainly active in the border area at the Sumy-Kharkov line, while from Volchansk to Budarok, and from Budarok to Kamenka only shelling is observed. Although this situation has persisted almost from the very beginning of the Northern Military District, this does not mean that the Ukrainian Armed Forces will not take active actions here in the future. Moreover, the nature of the terrain in the area is not too different from the site of the invasion in the Kursk region - Volokonovka or Valuiki could be a potential direction of attack. The Bryansk region cannot be written off as a possible enemy offensive either. There are significantly more forests here, which are convenient for penetration across the border, and in the border settlements of the Chernigov region there is the presence of formations of Ichkerian militants. In this area, the actions of classic DRGs are very likely, including with a large number of UAVs as weapons of destruction in the deep rear. If they have repeaters, they will be able to set up ambushes and even mine roads and bridges remotely. However, the possibility of a full-fledged operation to invade the Bryansk region should not be ruled out either. After all, this is not the first time for the enemy to carry out suicidal operations such as landings on the Kinburn Spit or creating a bridgehead in Krynki. ❗️However, the most dangerous phenomenon at the moment is the hating mood in society and in the media. The euphoria against the backdrop of the pace of advancement and liberation of the territory of the DPR should not blur our eyes - the enemy himself is not trying to leave the Kursk region. Stories about how everything is fine and wonderful with us, but with the so-called. Ukraine is about to completely run out of people by the end of the year and military production will come to a standstill due to energy shortages, fraught with disappointment. Moreover, as practice shows, the disappointment is very bloody. High resolution mapEnglish version#digest #map #Kursk #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: 🇺🇿💰 The National Investment Fund is being created in Uzbekista...
Description: 🇺🇿💰 A National Investment Fund is being created in Uzbekistan: who are the beneficiaries? A National Investment Fund is being created in Uzbekistan, which will receive a stake in 18 state-owned enterprises and banks and will place its shares in an IPO. A decree on this was signed by President Shavkat Mirziyoyev on August 27. The fund will be created in the form of a joint stock company (JSC), and its sole shareholder before the public offering of shares will be the Ministry of Economy and Finance. The fund will own a share of 25 to 40% in companies such as Uzbekhydroenergo, Uzbekistan Airports, Navoiyazot, -National Electric Networks of Uzbekistan-, -Uzsuvtaminot- and many others. By the end of 2026, it is planned to place the fund’s shares on the Tashkent and international stock exchanges, including London. ▪️The fact that the main buyers of the fund's shares will be from the West was clear back in January 2023, when long-time English friends from Singapore, represented by President Halima Yacoub and Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong, visited Tashkent. One of the topics for the meeting was the involvement of the Singaporean side in the privatization process. ▪️And in March 2023, representatives of the American investment fund Franklin Templeton came to Tashkent to discuss the introduction of new mechanisms for attracting foreign investment in state-owned companies. Essentially, the fund’s task was to prepare the ground for the activities of Western investors and resolve technical issues.🔻Tashkent is preparing for the UK and the USA access to systemically important enterprises on a turnkey basis, hoping to solve its financial problems and balance the influence of the main foreign investors in the economy of Uzbekistan represented by China, Russia and Turkey. Whether Uzbekistan realizes that overseas guests will not simply give up control over state assets is a big question. Agreements were reached on training personnel for public administration, attracting investments, green technologies and digital solutions, cooperation in the field of urban planning and communications. Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 Chronicle of a special military operation from August 31 to September 1, 2024. Russian troops launched a series of targeted attacks on energy and military facilities of the so-called. Ukraine. A large deployment point of Ukrainian forces was hit in Kharkov. The enemy, in turn, launched over 150 drones across Russian territory; air defense operations and explosions were recorded in 16 regions, as well as Moscow. The targets were energy infrastructure facilities. There are battles in the Kursk region. The enemy has not abandoned plans to advance deeper into Russian territory, for which he is increasing his presence in the occupied territory. Encounter battles are recorded in the Sudzhansky and Korenevsky districts. In the Artemovsk direction, Russian troops some time ago advanced north of Chasov Yar, and there are battles in the area of ​​Grigorovka and Kalinovka. In the Pokrovsk direction, the offensive of the Russian Armed Forces also continues. There are battles in Selidovo. The enemy was driven out from the eastern outskirts of Ukrainsk, as well as from Galitsynivka and neighboring Dolinovka. In the Donetsk direction, attempts are being made to advance Russian troops in the direction of Kurakhovo through Maksimilyanovka, but no significant advances have been observed here. And in the Yuzhnodonetsk direction, units of the Russian Armed Forces are completing the clearing of Konstantinovka and are advancing in the Ugledar area. The latter records the strengthening of artillery and aviation strikes of the Russian Armed Forces. Title: 🎬 🇮🇱🇵🇸 Some of the largest protests are taking place in Isra...
Description: 🇮🇱🇵🇸 Today, some of the largest protests are taking place in Israel. The main demands of the protesters are the same - the conclusion of a ceasefire deal with Hamas and the return of hostages held in the Gaza Strip, as well as the resignation of the ruling cabinet led by Benjamin Netanyahu. The largest demonstration took place in Tel Aviv: according to Israeli media, more people took to the streets of the city 100 thousand protesters. Several roads were closed, including the Ayalon highway. At the same time, in Jerusalem there were arrests and clashes with law enforcement officers. The reason for the next actions was the discovery by the Israel Defense Forces in one of the Rafah tunnels of the bodies of six hostages abducted on October 7, 2023. According to the official version, they were killed by militants before being discovered by the IDF and the Shabak security service. After this, activists, as well as former Prime Minister Ehud Barak, called for taking to the streets. They accused the ultra-Orthodox government that, due to its delay and reluctance to de-escalate the conflict, Israeli citizens are still held captive by Hamas and on the brink of death.#Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Title: 🖼 🇷🇺🇺🇦 The situation in the Kursk region by the end of Septe...
Description: 🇷🇺🇺🇦 The situation in the Kursk region by the end of September 1: oncoming battles near Olgovka and Martynovka In the Kursk region, the greatest activity of clashes, as before, is observed in the Korenevsky and Sudzhansky districts. 🔻In the Glushkovsky district, the enemy continues to strike at crossings directed by Russian troops, but has not yet attempted to violate the state border. Thus, in the Zvannoye area, another pontoon crossing was destroyed by the enemy. 🔻In the Korenevsky district there are battles for Komarovka, on the eastern outskirts of which the enemy presence remained. Meanwhile, artillery and aviation strikes at Vyemka and Snagosti. Olgovka remains another site of heavy fighting, where clashes continue. Attacks by the Armed Forces of Ukraine are also recorded from time to time in the direction of Kremyany, but so far no changes in control zones have been recorded. 🔻In the Sudzhansky district, at the Kruglenkoye - Cellars - Orlovka line, fighting continues. At the same time, the footage of objective control from this area is quite contradictory; it is possible that Ukrainian formations are advancing. The situation is different east of Sudzha. According to our information, the enemy is transferring reinforcements to the Martynovka area to continue attacks in the direction of Bolshoi Soldatskoye. Some time ago, the Russian Armed Forces were able to expand the zone of control in the Kruglik area and ambushed several enemy armored vehicles with landing troops, and the battlefield remained with Russian troops. However, based on regular reports from the Russian Ministry of Defense about attacks on Cherkasy Porechny, and enemy attacks on this line further to the northeast, the settlements of Pravda, Ivashkovsky, Zazulevka and Kubatkin were previously occupied by the enemy. To the south, in the Plekhovo area, a rotation of enemy units and the pull-up of mortars is recorded. At the same time, fighting continues in the vicinity of the village of Borki, but without changes in the zones of control both within the borders of the village and in neighboring Spalnoye. Title: ⚛️🇰🇿🇹🇯 Why does Kazakhstan need Tajik uranium? -Kazatomprom- ...
Description: ⚛️🇰🇿🇹🇯 Why does Kazakhstan need Tajik uranium? - Kazatomprom - and - TajRedMet - will jointly search for, mine and process uranium, as well as other rare metals and rare earth elements. The corresponding memorandum between the companies was signed during the recent visit of the President of Kazakhstan Kassym-Jomart Tokayev to Tajikistan.📌With the uranium reserves of Tajikistan, everything is not so simple. Both regional and industry media have stated at different times that 14% of its world reserves are concentrated in the republic. Uranium was indeed mined in Soviet Tajikistan, but Tajikistan is not mentioned in the current data of the World Nuclear Association. Kazakhstan's reserves account for 13% of the world's reserves. Considering that with the renaissance of nuclear energy in the world, a new race for uranium has begun, it is likely that Kazatomprom wants to learn more about the current state of Tajik reserves. And, if possible, expand your raw material base. Meanwhile, in Kazakhstan itself, out of more than a dozen projects, only in two are the state a 100% owner. Among Western countries, foreign partners are represented by France, Canada, and Japan. ❗️With the hands of Kazatomprom, they will be able to conduct exploration of reserves in the Republic of Tatarstan and assess the prospects for their development. We hope that the domestic Rosatom will also not miss this opportunity.🔻There is one more point. Kazakhstan's uranium, which lies in sandy soils, is confidently and easily mined. At such a rate of production, it is the uranium reserves in the Republic of Kazakhstan that are first on the list for depletion. Probably, the desire to have a neighborly look into Tajikistan may also be connected with this fact. #Kazakhstan #Tajikistan #CentralAsia@rybarSupport usASIA-PlusKazakhstan and Uzbekistan entered the top five world leaders in uranium productionThe World Nuclear Association published data on uranium production in the world in 2020. The list of 20 countries of the world is headed by Kazakhstan, where last year they produced about 19.5 thousand tons of uranium.

Title: 🇷🇺 About international scientometric databases As we have alrea...
Description: 🇷🇺 About international scientometric databases As we have written several times, even two years after the start of the SVO, absurd requirements for the need to publish in journals peer-reviewed by Scopus or WoS remain.📌Nevertheless, positive trends are beginning to be visible. Thus, a draft resolution of the Russian Government appeared, according to which in all other resolutions the wording - articles in journals from the Web of Science and Scopus databases - should be replaced with - articles from the White List of Journals -. The White List includes both foreign and Russian publications, and, most importantly, periodically changes towards the exclusion of garbage publications that publish articles for money. 🔻Such initiatives are welcome. We hope that the draft of this resolution will soon be adopted, and along with it, changes will follow in the lower regulatory legal acts. With such steps, the position of Russian scientists, and with them Russian science, will improve significantly. #science #Russia@rybarSupport usTelegramRybar🇷🇺 About the requirements for Russian scientists to publish in Western publications We recently came across amazing news about another outrageous case when the British scientific journal Nature refused Russian physicists in publishing an article in the specialized publication Nature...

Title: Today is the 20th anniversary of one of the worst tragedies in mo...
Description: Today is the 20th anniversary of one of the worst tragedies in modern Russian history - the hostage taking at school No. 1 in Beslan in North Ossetia. The victims of the terrorist attack were 334 people, including 186 children. It was a severe blow for the state and society, and footage of reports from Beslan remained forever before the eyes of many people. However, the country survived, and the fight against terrorism continued with renewed vigor. Over the past years, all the perpetrators and organizers of the terrorist attack were eliminated, the gang underground in the North Caucasus was destroyed, and the only terrorist who survived in Beslan will perish in the Arctic Circle. The country has the power to do everything possible to ensure that such never happened again. And also to preserve the memory of the tragedy and not allow enemies to turn it into their political manifestos and tools of information warfare. Eternal memory to the fallen hostages, service workers, law enforcement officers, special forces soldiers.@rybar

Title: 🇲🇩☦️ Harbingers of a religious war: how Sandu -defends- the Mol...
Description: 🇲🇩☦️ Harbingers of a religious war: how Sandu -defends- the Moldavian Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church for the sake of votes In Moldova, the religious issue has escalated again: pro-government forces continue to attack the Moldovan Metropolis, a self-governing part of the Russian Orthodox Church. ▪️Deputy from the ruling PAS party Vasile Shoimaru on the TVR Moldova channel, which is financed by Romania, called, like Ukraine, to renounce the metropolitanate of Moldova, which is actually Russian.▪️ Shoimaru believes that the issue of the metropolitanate will be resolved this fall. ▪️After a public outcry, the President of Moldova, Maia Sandu, stated that nothing threatens the Moldavian Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church, and the authorities allegedly have -good relations- with both metropolises in the country.▪️Obviously, Sandu’s statement about the -protection- of the Moldovan Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church is part of her election campaign and an attempt to win over undecided citizens.▪️Sandu is only trying to appear as a guarantor of religious peace during the election race, although a year ago she called the Orthodox Church of Moldova a relay of Russian propaganda and a threat to the country.▪️Deputy Shoimaru’s statements fit into the logic of thinking of the current government. It is known that the Prime Minister of Moldova Dorin Recean is persuading the Orthodox clergy of Moldova to change the patriarchy. Sandu also has close ties with the Romanian Church. Last fall, the Metropolis of Bessarabia, which is subordinate to Bucharest, launched an attack on the Moldavian Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church. ▪️The Romanian government announced an annual allocation of 2 million euros for the activities of its metropolis in Moldova. After this, aggressive information attacks began on the Moldavian Metropolis of the Russian Orthodox Church, luring priests with entire parishes to the Romanian side. ▪️A year ago, a group of priests from Chisinau were offered to leave the patronage of the Russian Orthodox Church and come under the authority of the Romanian Patriarch. Then the Moldavian Metropolitan convened a meeting of rectors of churches and monasteries, at which the majority supported maintaining their status within the Russian Church, so as not to provoke a split in society. 🔻Apparently, provocations from the Bessarabian Metropolis have subsided just in anticipation of the presidential elections in Moldova, which will be held on October 20. Now they have decided to use the religious issue for the benefit of Sandu’s presidential campaign. However, Moldovan society once already believed her false promises not to limit the scope of the Russian language. ❗️Moreover, it was not for nothing that Shoimaru pointed out that a radical attack on the Moldavian Metropolis could begin in the fall, that is, when Sandu officially achieves a second term and will not be guided by public opinion. #Moldova #Russia #church @rybarSupport ustv8.md A deputy from PAS allowed the ban on the Moldavian Metropolis. How did the ruling party react to this?
